title: 111_hr1182
content: The Act titled "Military Spouses Residency Relief Act" guarantees residency for military personnel spouses for voting purposes. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to include provisions for spouses of military personnel regarding voting residency. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to include provisions for spouses of military personnel regarding voting residency. The table of contents is updated to reflect the changes. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to guarantee residency for military personnel and their spouses. This applies to absences from specified states on or after the enactment date, regardless of military orders. Additionally, there are provisions for determining the tax residence of military spouses. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to ensure that military spouses do not lose or acquire residency for tax purposes when accompanying their servicemember spouse on military orders. The Servicemembers Civil Relief Act is amended to exempt the income of military spouses from being considered taxable if they are not residents of the jurisdiction where the income is earned due to accompanying their servicemember spouse on military orders. Individuals are exempt from income tax for any taxable year starting from the year of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 4. Suspension of land rights residency requirement for spouses of military personnel. An amendment allows the spouse of a servicemember in military service to be exempt from the residency requirement. This applies to servicemembers on or after the enactment of this Act.
